results.title: Israeli air raid on building housing international media
results.material_description: screen recording of @AJEnglish’s Twitter Digital screen recording from @AJEnglish's Twitter
results.brief_description: In the sixth consecutive day of hostilities between Israel and Hamas, Israeli airstrikes bombed a 15-storey block in the heart of Gaza that housed private homes and workplaces as well as the offices of media organisations Al Jazeera and the Associated Press. Defending the attack, Israeli officials stated that Hamas was operating an intelligence cell out in the building yet AP executive editor Sally Buzbee has called for an independent inquiry into the strike stating that this attack destroyed the ability for news reporting in the territory vehemently fighting for the world’s right to know. “This is an important story and because of the actions yesterday, the world is going to know less.”
results.title_for_label: Israeli air raid on building housing international media
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

In the sixth consecutive day of attacks between Israeli and Palestinian forces, Israel bombed a 15-storey block in Gaza City claiming that Hamas was operating an intelligence cell in the building. Along with the private homes and workplaces in the building, it housed the offices of media organisations Al Jazeera and the Associated Press who were given advance warning of the bombing. Al Jazeera broadcast live, in real time, footage of their own offices being destroyed which went viral changing the international coverage of the ongoing Israel-Palestine conflict. AP executive editor Sally Buzbee has called for an independent inquiry into the strike, stating “This is an important story and because of the actions yesterday, the world is going to know less.”

results.title: Convicted on all charges
results.brief_description: The murder of George Floyd by a Minneapolis police officer was captured on video and incited waves of protests in the US and around the world. When the jury swiftly and unanimously convicted the officer of all charges, huge crowds gathered to pay their respects to Floyd at the intersection where he took his last breaths. Minnesota’s attorney general, Keith Ellison welcomed the conviction stating, “This verdict reminds us that we must make enduring… enduring systemic, societal change.” Three other officers face trial for aiding and abetting murder and manslaughter. Key to securing the conviction was a video taken by a bystander.

results.title: What is happing in #SuezCanal today explained
results.brief_description: On March 23, the sight of a container ship lodged inside the Suez Canal like a car abandoned during a bad parallel park enthralled the world. But the traffic the Ever Given blocked wasn’t insignificant, with hundreds of other vessels barred from delivering supplies and the stock market affected. A catastrophe yes, but one that flooded the internet with hilarious memes, like this one from Zaina Erhaim, which married the logistical absurdity with an equally absurd and iconic scene from Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery.

results.title: [The funeral of Field Marshal Sir Thomas Blamey]
results.brief_description:
This film contains documentary footage of the state funeral of Field Marshal Sir Thomas Blamey, which took place on 30 May, 1951 in Melbourne, Victoria.

The film captures the funeral cortege as it proceeds along Swanston Street, with crowds of people lining the streets and buildings. The flag-covered casket is accompanied by a military band, soldiers and dignitaries. Significant public figures marching in the cortege include Prime Minister Robert Menzies, Governor-General William McKell, Governor of Victoria Sir Dallas Brooks and Chief Justice of the High Court Sir John Latham.

The film includes wonderful footage of Swanston Street from a high vantage point with the Shrine of Remembrance in the distance. There are also great shots of soldiers marching together, military horses, people gathered in front of the Melbourne City Baths and a couple watching on atop the facade of the ‘W.H. Terry Memorial Hall’.

An estimated 300,000 people turned out to watch the funeral procession, which travelled from the Shrine of Remembrance, along St Kilda Road, and up Swanston Street to College Crescent, before proceeding by car to Fawkner Crematorium.

Sir Thomas Blamey (24 Jan 1884 – 27 May 1951) was a General in the Australian army and the only Australian to have achieved the rank of Field Marshal.

results.title: Grace Tame’s address to the National Press Club
results.brief_description: When Australian of the Year Grace Tame, an activist and advocate for survivors of sexual assault, was asked what she thought of Prime Minister Scott Morrison’s response ‘as a father’ to rape allegations made by Brittany Higgins, Tame did not mince her words. Herself a survivor of child sexual abuse and influential in the Let Her Speak Campaign, Tame used the National Press Club address to call on fellow survivors, saying “Share your truth, it is your power. One voice, your voice, and our collective voices can make a difference”.

results.title: Trump supporters minding the velvet ropes
results.material_description: Digital screen recording from C-Span's YouTube channel
results.brief_description: After years of consuming viral misinformation, pro-Trump insurgents stormed the US Capitol building in early 2021, pausing their vandalising and looting only to take selfies, as if part of a legitimate sightseeing tour. They even obeyed the velvet ropes, despite dismissing democracy.

constellations_other.name: Fake news: too little too late
constellations_other.description: Unbound Creations’ Headliner: NoviNews explores the impact of the media and fake news on society, something that is fast becoming one of the biggest concerns of our age.

results.title_for_label: Screen recording of C-Span’s news footage ‘Trump supporters minding the velvet ropes’
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

For several hours on 6 January 2021, pro-Tromp insurgents occupied and vandalised the US Capitol building to protest his 2020 presidential election defeat. It was the grim climax of Trump’s “Save America” rally, where he incited the mob to “take back our country”. After years of consuming viral misinformation and conspiracy theories, the rioters enthusiastically played out their apocalyptic fantasies, taking pictures and selfies amidst the mayhem as if part of a legitimate sightseeing tour. They even obeyed the velvet guide ropes, despite showing little care for democracy or the five people who died from the event.

constellations_primary.description: Though originally intended as a laugh, Celeste Baber’s social media posts have become examples of body positivity to her eight million followers and challenge the absurd expectations put on women in society.

results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Smartphones aren’t a mirror, but the images and videos influencers and celebrities post on social media can seem like standards we should reflect. Australian comedian Celeste Barber isn’t aspiring to these unrealistic ideals. Since 2015, Barber’s resisted the swarm of air-brushed and unattainable images with her #celestechallengeaccepted project, an experiment to see how normal people look recreating the perfectly staged poses of the rich and Insta-famous. Though originally intended as a laugh, Barber’s posts have become examples of body positivity to her eight million followers and challenge the absurd expectations put on women in society.

results.title: [Phillip Annett Home Movie]
results.brief_description:
This home movie was originally created on 16mm film by Phillip Annett. It was donated to ACMI by Daryl Annett.

This film is a snap shot of suburban life in Melbourne. There are wonderful examples of fashion, inner-Melbourne street scenes, architecture and cars of the time. We see a children’s birthday party and backyard games under the Hills Hoist as well as neighbours chatting over the fence to passers-by in the street. Men in Australian Army and Air Force uniforms pose and smile for the camera, and there are scenes of a road trip to regional Victoria. We see a fire truck display, horse and harness riding as well as woodchopping displays at the Royal Melbourne Show. There are candid images of a horse event competitor in the stables area of the Royal Melbourne Show, as well as St Kilda Road buses and trams as they travel down the road. Black and white images of a horse and cart and a man in a bowler hat performing tricks is a fantastic moment in time.

results.title: Ghosts, Toasts and the Things Unsaid
results.material_description: Samsung Galaxy S7 mobile phone, Samsung Gear VR HMD and executable file
results.brief_description:
Steve and Maude are keeping secrets. Do you want to hear them? Become their ghosts and haunt the kitchen where they fell in love, grew old and apart.

‘Ghosts, Toast and the Things Unsaid’ is an intimate virtual reality (VR) experience that explores the thoughts we don’t share, the desires we keep covered and how they affect our relationships. The work invites audiences into the lives of two characters, Maude and Steve, and into the kitchen where they fell in love and grew old together over 50 years. In the intimate, two-person VR experience, audiences choose the ghost they inhabit, then enter into the memory of their character to journey through time, discovering what went wrong in their relationship.

‘Ghosts, Toast and the Things Unsaid’ is a virtual reality (VR) experience, consisting of two different asynchronous VR screenings in a custom Android application, deployed to a Samsung Galaxy 8 mobile phone and Samsung Gear headset. This VR application is experienced within a physical installation that is an integral part of the exhibition of this work.

In the exhibit at ACMI visitors were greeted by a staff member who sent them into one of two specially designed booths via a ouija board. The booths contained a ghost sheet housing a hidden virtual reality headset and headphones. Depending on which booth visitors entered they were transported back to the life of characters Steve or Maude. A VR headset was placed on the visitors head, and a ghost sheet buttoned on top. The application initially activated the camera of the device. The device’s camera was lined up with one of the ghost sheet’s eye holes. In front of the visitor was a mirror, allowing them to see themselves, seated wearing the ghost sheet. The 360 degree video then replaced the camera view and played out to its duration. Characters moved in 360 degrees around the visitor. By changing their orientation, visitors could hear the inner voice of the characters they chose to look at and follow them around the room as they moved.

‘Ghosts, Toast and the Things Unsaid’ has been commissioned in partnership with Google’s Creative Lab, and produced by creative agency Sandpit in partnership with Grumpy Sailor, the technology build partner for this commission.

The exhibit at ACMI was based on a play, co-developed by Google’s Creative Lab and Sandpit, which was first performed at the Adelaide Fringe Festival, where it won the award for ‘Best Interactive’. ACMI’s commission incorporates a 360 degree video recording of the live performance into a 16 minute VR experience.

Sandpit’s Director, Dan Koerner, says the ACMI commission has given his company the ability to tell a made-for-theatre story in a new way.

“At Sandpit we love telling stories using a huge range of tools. The ACMI commission to make ‘Ghosts, Toast and the Things Unsaid’ into a VR film has been a great example of this; moving from digitally augmented live performance to virtual reality with a great team of performers, composers, designers and developers. The project has allowed us to use technology to fully immerse audiences in a way that is surprising and we hope, quite moving.”

results.title: Mots' Mansion [videogame trailer]
results.brief_description: Special Mention in the Middle Videogame category. Sam, Bec and their Mother move in to Grandma’s house. But when Bec is captured, Sam needs to complete tasks given to him by the mysterious MOTS. Can he trust the Man on the Stairs and will they both make it out. In the end, the choices you make will matter.
